newsitem.title: BULGARIA: YIELD FALLS ON BULGARIA 6-MTH, FLOATER T-BILLS.
newsitem.headline: YIELD FALLS ON BULGARIA 6-MTH, FLOATER T-BILLS.

text.p: Yield fell at Monday's auction of
Bulgaria's Finance Ministry six-month, floating interest
T-bills due to a lower discount and a cut in the central bank
main interest rate, central bank figures showed on Tuesday.
The average yield to maturity on the T-bills fell to 34.01
percent from 41.02 percent at the previous auction on May 5.
The average accepted price for the issue was 97.84 percent
of par, up from 97.22 percent at the previous auction.
Interest on the paper was set equal to the central bank
main interest rate, which was cut to 5.2 percent monthly from
6.2 percent, in force from Monday, and is adjusted each time
the rate changes.
Interest is due at maturity together with the par value of
the issue.
The issue was offered with no par value or minimum
acceptable price set in advance.
Details of the issue follow. Prices in percent of par:
Issue number BG3032997028
Maturity six months
Auction date May 12
Issue date May 14
Maturity date November 12
Bids received 20,786.9 mln levs
Avg price of bids 97.73 pct
Bids approved 11,357.1 mln levs
Avg accepted price 97.84 pct
Avg yield to maturity 34.01 pct
-- Sofia Newsroom, (++359-2) 91188
